articles.title: Billionaire boss Ivan Glasenberg makes one last coal deal in final days at Glencore - News24
articles.description: Glencore has agreed to buy stakes owned by BHP Group and Anglo American Plc in the Cerrejon thermal coal mine, giving the world’s biggest shipper of the fuel complete control of the asset.
articles.content:
Glencore’s billionaire boss Ivan Glasenberg has made one final deal in his last week at the company, buying out two rivals in a giant Colombian coal mine.

articles.title: Native Americans want to talk with Harry & Meghan over fears they are using ‘holy water’ on their gardens - PerthNow
articles.description: Native Americans fear that Prince Harry and Meghan are using ‘holy water’ to irrigate the expansive gardens of their $20 million Californian mansion.
articles.content:
Its no surprise that Prince Harry and Meghan want to give the gardens at their new Californian pad the royal treatment but using Native American holy water may be taking it too far.

articles.title: Holbrooke’s Revenge: How Modi Led the Americans Back into Kashmir - The Wire
articles.description: The ending of autonomy in Kashmir reconstituted a conflict that was politically frozen in many ways for decades and has set it off in directions that can increase Washington’s diplomatic costs in the region.

articles.title: Toronto breaks record for COVID-19 vaccinations - CBC.ca
articles.description: Toronto broke the North American record for delivering the most COVID-19 vaccinations at a single site in a single day. Roughly 25,0000 people went to Scotiabank Arena to roll up their sleeves and push the city over the top.
